content: In business mathematics, profit and loss are fundamental concepts that quantify the financial performance of a business.
This chapter explores the mathematical relationships between cost, revenue, and profit.
section1.name: Introduction

content: C = Cost price (the amount spent to produce or acquire goods)
S = Selling price (the amount received from selling goods)
section2.name: Basic Definitions

content: When S > C, a profit is made: P = S - C
subsection1.name: Profit Equation

content: When C > S, a loss is incurred: P = S - C (note: P will be negative in this case)
